page.title: 13WIVENHOE 70 YEARS AGO
page.content: Elmstead the boundary runs right up the centre of Anglesea road and when I was a child I used to play on it. Over the years they demolished it. {Sharon:}What was your school called? {Mrs Allen:}Just the Wivenhoe Infants and it was in Philip road. {Natasha:}Were the facilities alot different then than now? {Mrs Allen:}Well we didn't have school dinners there was no stainless steel it was all where you had to clean the knifes with bath brick.There was sort of steel handles some had bone handles.If you were rich you might have silver there was lino floors everywhere all over the house and the real posh people had lovely wooden floors.Most of the workclass had lino. {Sarah:}Where any of the shops that are here now here when you 1st moved here?
